section.name: name
section.description: hc - an HCLI for interacting with a CNC via GRBL Controller (e.g. an OpenBuilds BlackBox controller via input and output streams

section.name: synopsis
section.description: hc <command>

section.name: description
section.description:
The "hc" HCLI allows you to control a CNC through the command line (e.g. OpenBuilds C-Beam Machine) via the GRBL protocol. You can send G-Code commands as an input stream, and the GRBL service will respond accordingly.

This HCLI relies on the use of a serial port to a GRBL compliant device. You can scan to find out which serial device you can send G-Code streams to.

Note that the hc CNC HCLI doesn't queue jobs properly for sequential streaming execution in a multiprocess context (e.g. multiple workers under gunicorn. Please configure the environment such that the HCLI runs in a single process (e.g. --workers=1 under a gunicorn configuration. See "hcli_core help" for a example configuration for hc).

section.name: examples
section.description:
hc scan

hc connect /dev/tty.usbserial-AR0JI0GV

echo '$$' | hc

cat test.gcode | hc

command.name: scan
command.description: The "scan" command scans and lists connected serial devices.

command.name: reset
command.description: The "reset" command stops the CNC by sending the soft reset ctrl-x command to the GRBL controller.

command.name: status
command.description: The "status" command returns the current status of the GRBL controller by sending the ? command.

command.name: stop
command.description: The "stop" command pauses the CNC by sending the ! command to the GRBL controller (feed hold).

command.name: resume
command.description: The "resume" command resumes the CNC by sending the ~ command to the GRBL controller (cycle start).

command.name: connect
command.description: The "connect" command connects to the GRBL controller via serial port by attempting to wake it up.

command.name: home
command.description: The "home" command is used to home the CNC by sending the '$H' signal.

command.name: unlock
command.description: The "unlock" command is used to kill an alarm lock by sending the '$X' signal.

command.name: disconnect
command.description: The "disconnect" command disconnects from the GRBL controller.

option.name: -j
option.description: The "-j" option is used to help supply a friendly job name to indicate job purpose and sequencing.

section.name: description
section.description: The "reset" command sends the ctrl-x signal (0x18) to the GRBL controller. The immediately halts and safely soft resets Grbl without a power-cycle.

section.name: description
